m-and-a.title: Corporate and M&A
m-and-a.desc: Comprehensive advice to national and international clients on global corporate reorganizations, mergers, acquisitions, and joint ventures.
m-and-a.fullContent: Our Corporate and Mergers & Acquisitions team stands out for providing comprehensive key advice to both national and international clients on global corporate reorganizations, mergers, acquisitions, and joint ventures. With extensive industry experience and a commitment to personalized solutions, we guide our clients through every stage of their transactions, from due diligence and negotiation to post-closing integration, helping them achieve growth and success. Our expertise has positioned our team as strategic key advisors for those undertaking corporate reorganizations, optimizing corporate governance and aligning stakeholders across multiple jurisdictions in the most comprehensive, efficient, and agile manner. Our team has an outstanding track record of assisting local companies in their international expansion, as well as helping foreign companies establish themselves in our region.

banking.title: Banking & Finance
banking.desc: Strategic legal counsel to banks in regulatory matters, financial products, lending, and extensions of credit.
banking.fullContent: We provide strategic legal counsel to banks in regulatory, as well as in financial products, lending, and other extensions of credit. Our B&F team has developed a wide range of highly sophisticated finance, treasury, and foreign exchange products tailored to specific client objectives and has extensive experience in cross-border financial services, particularly with foreign banks providing such services to clients in the region. Our team has a strong, successful, and proven record in retail finance, automobile finance and specialty retail, such as in agricultural inputs and sowing programs.

capital-markets.title: Capital Markets
capital-markets.desc: Advisory services in capital markets transactions, assisting clients with securities issuances and key financial operations.
capital-markets.fullContent: We provide advisory services in capital markets transactions, assisting our clients with securities issuances and key financial operations to support their growth plans and structural financial changes, including capital strategies and debt issuance. We tailor our solutions to private equity scenarios, managing fund formation, overseeing transactions, and offering strategic guidance on investments, ensuring that our clients are well-positioned to capitalize on market opportunities and achieve substantial growth.

tax.title: Tax
tax.desc: Specialized advice in tax planning, compliance, litigation, and transfer pricing both in Venezuela and abroad.
tax.fullContent: Our Tax Practice specializes in providing high-value strategic advice in tax planning, compliance, tax litigation, and transfer pricing. definition1.title: What Is Tax Planning?
definition1.content: Tax Planning refers to the legitimate structuring of business activities and transactions to minimize tax burdens within the bounds of applicable law. Unlike tax evasion (which is illegal), tax planning relies on understanding tax codes, utilizing available incentives, and timing decisions to achieve efficiency. Effective tax planning considers not only immediate savings but long-term defensibility, regulatory trends, and commercial alignment.

practice.paragraph2: The corporate tax landscape across Latin America is characterized by frequent regulatory change, evolving transfer pricing enforcement, and increasing alignment with OECD standards. definition2.title: What Is Transfer Pricing?
definition2.content: Transfer Pricing governs the pricing of transactions between related entities within a corporate group—intercompany loans, service fees, royalties, and goods transfers. Tax authorities scrutinize these transactions to ensure they reflect arm's length terms (what unrelated parties would agree to). Failure to maintain compliant transfer pricing documentation can result in significant adjustments, penalties, and double taxation.

practice.paragraph3: Cross-border operations demand integrated thinking. We coordinate with trusted advisors in Mexico, the United States, and across Latin America to ensure that structures work across jurisdictions—not just in isolation.

definition3.title: What Is International Tax Structuring?

This includes holding company jurisdiction selection, treaty utilization, permanent establishment analysis, and financing structures. The goal is efficiency without aggressive positions—structures that regulatory authorities will respect.

individual.question: What is the difference between individual and collective labor disputes?
individual.answer: Individual disputes involve one employee (e.g., wrongful termination, unpaid wages), while collective disputes involve unions or groups of workers (e.g., collective bargaining, strikes). contingencies.question: How do labor contingencies affect M&A transactions?
contingencies.answer: Unresolved labor liabilities (unpaid severance, union obligations, misclassified contractors) create financial and operational risk for acquirers. compliance.answer: Primary risks include failure to register employees with social security, improper wage/hour practices, inadequate severance reserves, non-compliance with profit-sharing requirements, and exposure to labor authority audits. crossBorder.answer: Key issues include work permits/visas, employment contract localization (which country's law applies), tax residency and social security contributions, employee secondments vs. permanent transfers, and coordination of benefits across jurisdictions. We structure compliant mobility arrangements and coordinate with local counsel.
